column2: I don't see what difference that makes, observed the Patchwork Girl, as they found the path and continued their journey.

column2: The shape doesn't make a thing honest, does it?

column2: Of course it does, returned the Woozy, very decidedly.
column3: Of course it does, returned the Woozy, very decidedly.

column2: No one could trust that Crooked Magician, for instance, just because he is crooked; but a square Woozy couldn't do anything crooked if he wanted to.
column3: No one could trust that Crooked Magician, for instance, just because he is crooked; but a square Woozy couldn't do anything crooked if he wanted to.

column2: I am neither square nor crooked, said Scraps, looking down at her plump body.
column3: I am neither square nor crooked, said Scraps, looking down at her plump body.

column2: No; you're round, so you're liable to do anything, asserted the Woozy.

column2: Do not blame me, Miss Gorgeous, if I regard you with suspicion. Many a satin ribbon has a cotton back.

column2: Scraps didn't understand this, but she had an uneasy misgiving that she had a cotton back herself.
